channel.title: A data explorer
channel.description: Recent content on A data explorer

item.title: Partisan Clustering of Categories in Enacted Bills
item.description: Which party is the original sponsor for enacted bills between congress 113 to 117? Data is fetched from the ProPublica API. At first glance, the counts of enacted bills from the Republican party are greater for most categories than for the Democratic party. This is especially clear in the 114th and 115th Congress which is no surprise at all because Republicans controlled both chambers of Congress in those years. Separately, we can see when both parties have overlapping interests, e.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello üëã! My name is Mei Wu (she/her), a Bioinformatician at the University of Washington working with the Eichler Lab. My professional interest is in uncovering insights within the human genome to explain the etiology of neurodevelopmental disorders. Currently, I am living in Seattle, WA. I like coffee ‚òï, baking üç∞, reading about USA politics, and making time for RPG board games (e.g. Gloomhaven). üåµ This blog is powered by Hugo, with a forked version of the Cactus theme.
